intro: Polycnemum juniperinum, commonly known as the Juniper-leaf groundsel, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its upright, herbaceous stem and narrow, linear leaves that resemble those of juniper. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are typical of the daisy family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Polycnemum juniperinum is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
